chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey N Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Defendant shall have no contact with Corey U. unless authorized by Probation Agent.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or be present where drugs are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall notify health care providers of addiction history.
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Resolution reached with defense free to argue.  Counsel consents to proceeding without a written Information.  Court directs State to file an Information within 48 hours.  Defense is in agreement with State's sentencing recommendation.  State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 1 and 3.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2 and orders Cts. 1 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Statements by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
